text: An appeal to popularity, also called argumentum ad populum (Latin for "appeal to the people"), is a logical fallacy. It happens when someone tries to argue that something is right because lots of people believe in it.Austin Cline. Argumentum ad Populum An example is saying "many people buy extended warranties, therefore we should buy one for our new computer". ==Related pages== * Argumentum ad hominem ==References== Category:Logical fallacies
title: Appeal to popularity
